thread.title: Lynne Patton of Eric Trump charity lands federal HUD job | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Lynne Patton of Eric Trump charity lands federal HUD job | Daily Mail Online

author: Geoff Earle
title: Lynne Patton of Eric Trump charity lands federal HUD job | Daily Mail Online

organizations.name: department of housing and urban development

text: show ad Lynne Patton, who helped plan Eric and Lara Trump's wedding and oversaw millions in donations as VP of Trump charity foundation, lands a job at Ben Carson's Housing Department Lynne Patton attended a Black History Month event at the White House with President Donald Trump and other guests While other attendees introduced themselves, Trump called her 'Lynne' She was a vice president at the Eric Trump Foundation, a charity Eric Trump suspended fundraising efforts for after his father won the presidency She also helped plan Eric and Lara Trump's wedding, and spoke at the Republican National Convention Patton told Trump that she would be joining the Department of Housing and Urban Development, where she will serve as a senior advisor and director of the office of public liaison She later told DailyMail.com she accepted the post in lieu of a White House position he had offered her During the campaign she cut a video slamming 'reprehensible attempts' to link Trump to hate groups and vouched for his character amid charges of racism She will serve under Secretary Ben Carson, who got quizzed during confirmation hearings about whether he would act to benefit the Trump Organization Trump Organization gets housing subsidies through a low-income housing project Published: 18:07 GMT, 1 February 2017 | Updated: 02:56 GMT, 2 February 2017 52 shares
